6// PlatformMethods.h: The public interface ANGLE exposes to the API layer, for
7// doing platform-specific tasks like gathering data, or for tracing.
8
9#ifndef ANGLE_PLATFORMMETHODS_H
10#define ANGLE_PLATFORMMETHODS_H
11
12#include <stdint.h>
13#include <stdlib.h>
14#include <array>
15
16#define EGL_PLATFORM_ANGLE_PLATFORM_METHODS_ANGLEX 0x34FD
17
18#if !defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_EXPORT)
19# if defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__clang__)
20# define ANGLE_PLATFORM_EXPORT __attribute__((visibility("default")))
21# endif
22#endif
23#if !defined(ANGLE_PLATFORM_EXPORT)
24# define ANGLE_PLATFORM_EXPORT
25#endif
26
27#if defined(_WIN32)
28# define ANGLE_APIENTRY __stdcall
29#else
30# define ANGLE_APIENTRY
31#endif
32
33namespace angle
34{
35struct FeaturesD3D;
36struct FeaturesVk;
37struct FeaturesMtl;
38using TraceEventHandle = uint64_t;
39using EGLDisplayType = void *;
40struct PlatformMethods;
41
42// Use a C-like API to not trigger undefined calling behaviour.
43// Avoid using decltype here to work around sanitizer limitations.
44// TODO(jmadill): Use decltype here if/when UBSAN is fixed.
45
46// System --------------------------------------------------------------
47
48// Wall clock time in seconds since the epoch.
49// TODO(jmadill): investigate using an ANGLE internal time library
50using CurrentTimeFunc = double (*)(PlatformMethods *platform);
51inline double DefaultCurrentTime(PlatformMethods *platform)
52{
53 return 0.0;
54}
55
56// Monotonically increasing time in seconds from an arbitrary fixed point in the past.
57// This function is expected to return at least millisecond-precision values. For this reason,
58// it is recommended that the fixed point be no further in the past than the epoch.
59using MonotonicallyIncreasingTimeFunc = double (*)(PlatformMethods *platform);
60inline double DefaultMonotonicallyIncreasingTime(PlatformMethods *platform)
61{
62 return 0.0;
63}
64
65// Logging ------------------------------------------------------------
66
67// Log an error message within the platform implementation.
68using LogErrorFunc = void (*)(PlatformMethods *platform, const char *errorMessage);
69inline void DefaultLogError(PlatformMethods *platform, const char *errorMessage) {}
70
71// Log a warning message within the platform implementation.
72using LogWarningFunc = void (*)(PlatformMethods *platform, const char *warningMessage);
73inline void DefaultLogWarning(PlatformMethods *platform, const char *warningMessage) {}
74
75// Log an info message within the platform implementation.
76using LogInfoFunc = void (*)(PlatformMethods *platform, const char *infoMessage);
77inline void DefaultLogInfo(PlatformMethods *platform, const char *infoMessage) {}
78
79// Tracing --------
80
81// Get a pointer to the enabled state of the given trace category. The
82// embedder can dynamically change the enabled state as trace event
83// recording is started and stopped by the application. Only long-lived
84// literal strings should be given as the category name. The implementation
85// expects the returned pointer to be held permanently in a local static. If
86// the unsigned char is non-zero, tracing is enabled. If tracing is enabled,
87// addTraceEvent is expected to be called by the trace event macros.
88using GetTraceCategoryEnabledFlagFunc = const unsigned char *(*)(PlatformMethods *platform,
89 const char *categoryName);
90inline const unsigned char *DefaultGetTraceCategoryEnabledFlag(PlatformMethods *platform,
91 const char *categoryName)
92{
93 return nullptr;
94}
95
96//
97// Add a trace event to the platform tracing system. Depending on the actual
98// enabled state, this event may be recorded or dropped.
99// - phase specifies the type of event:
100// - BEGIN ('B'): Marks the beginning of a scoped event.
101// - END ('E'): Marks the end of a scoped event.
102// - COMPLETE ('X'): Marks the beginning of a scoped event, but doesn't
103// need a matching END event. Instead, at the end of the scope,
104// updateTraceEventDuration() must be called with the TraceEventHandle
105// returned from addTraceEvent().
106// - INSTANT ('I'): Standalone, instantaneous event.
107// - START ('S'): Marks the beginning of an asynchronous event (the end
108// event can occur in a different scope or thread). The id parameter is
109// used to match START/FINISH pairs.
110// - FINISH ('F'): Marks the end of an asynchronous event.
111// - COUNTER ('C'): Used to trace integer quantities that change over
112// time. The argument values are expected to be of type int.
113// - METADATA ('M'): Reserved for internal use.
114// - categoryEnabled is the pointer returned by getTraceCategoryEnabledFlag.
115// - name is the name of the event. Also used to match BEGIN/END and
116// START/FINISH pairs.
117// - id optionally allows events of the same name to be distinguished from
118// each other. For example, to trace the construction and destruction of
119// objects, specify the pointer as the id parameter.
120// - timestamp should be a time value returned from monotonicallyIncreasingTime.
121// - numArgs specifies the number of elements in argNames, argTypes, and
122// argValues.
123// - argNames is the array of argument names. Use long-lived literal strings
124// or specify the COPY flag.
125// - argTypes is the array of argument types:
126// - BOOL (1): bool
127// - UINT (2): unsigned long long
128// - INT (3): long long
129// - DOUBLE (4): double
130// - POINTER (5): void*
131// - STRING (6): char* (long-lived null-terminated char* string)
132// - COPY_STRING (7): char* (temporary null-terminated char* string)
133// - CONVERTABLE (8): WebConvertableToTraceFormat
134// - argValues is the array of argument values. Each value is the unsigned
135// long long member of a union of all supported types.
136// - flags can be 0 or one or more of the following, ORed together:
137// - COPY (0x1): treat all strings (name, argNames and argValues of type
138// string) as temporary so that they will be copied by addTraceEvent.
139// - HAS_ID (0x2): use the id argument to uniquely identify the event for
140// matching with other events of the same name.
141// - MANGLE_ID (0x4): specify this flag if the id parameter is the value
142// of a pointer.
143using AddTraceEventFunc = angle::TraceEventHandle (*)(PlatformMethods *platform,
144 char phase,
145 const unsigned char *categoryEnabledFlag,
146 const char *name,
147 unsigned long long id,
148 double timestamp,
149 int numArgs,
150 const char **argNames,
151 const unsigned char *argTypes,
152 const unsigned long long *argValues,
153 unsigned char flags);
154inline angle::TraceEventHandle DefaultAddTraceEvent(PlatformMethods *platform,
155 char phase,
156 const unsigned char *categoryEnabledFlag,
157 const char *name,
158 unsigned long long id,
159 double timestamp,
160 int numArgs,
161 const char **argNames,
162 const unsigned char *argTypes,
163 const unsigned long long *argValues,
164 unsigned char flags)
165{
166 return 0;
167}
168
169// Set the duration field of a COMPLETE trace event.
170using UpdateTraceEventDurationFunc = void (*)(PlatformMethods *platform,
171 const unsigned char *categoryEnabledFlag,
172 const char *name,
173 angle::TraceEventHandle eventHandle);
174inline void DefaultUpdateTraceEventDuration(PlatformMethods *platform,
175 const unsigned char *categoryEnabledFlag,
176 const char *name,
177 angle::TraceEventHandle eventHandle)
178{}
179
180// Callbacks for reporting histogram data.
181// CustomCounts histogram has exponential bucket sizes, so that min=1, max=1000000, bucketCount=50
182// would do.
183using HistogramCustomCountsFunc = void (*)(PlatformMethods *platform,
184 const char *name,
185 int sample,
186 int min,
187 int max,
188 int bucketCount);
189inline void DefaultHistogramCustomCounts(PlatformMethods *platform,
190 const char *name,
191 int sample,
192 int min,
193 int max,
194 int bucketCount)
195{}
196// Enumeration histogram buckets are linear, boundaryValue should be larger than any possible sample
197// value.
198using HistogramEnumerationFunc = void (*)(PlatformMethods *platform,
199 const char *name,
200 int sample,
201 int boundaryValue);
202inline void DefaultHistogramEnumeration(PlatformMethods *platform,
203 const char *name,
204 int sample,
205 int boundaryValue)
206{}
207// Unlike enumeration histograms, sparse histograms only allocate memory for non-empty buckets.
208using HistogramSparseFunc = void (*)(PlatformMethods *platform, const char *name, int sample);
209inline void DefaultHistogramSparse(PlatformMethods *platform, const char *name, int sample) {}
210// Boolean histograms track two-state variables.
211using HistogramBooleanFunc = void (*)(PlatformMethods *platform, const char *name, bool sample);
212inline void DefaultHistogramBoolean(PlatformMethods *platform, const char *name, bool sample) {}
213
214// Allows us to programatically override ANGLE's default workarounds for testing purposes.
215using OverrideWorkaroundsD3DFunc = void (*)(PlatformMethods *platform,
216 angle::FeaturesD3D *featuresD3D);
217inline void DefaultOverrideWorkaroundsD3D(PlatformMethods *platform,
218 angle::FeaturesD3D *featuresD3D)
219{}
220
221using OverrideFeaturesVkFunc = void (*)(PlatformMethods *platform,
222 angle::FeaturesVk *featuresVulkan);
223inline void DefaultOverrideFeaturesVk(PlatformMethods *platform, angle::FeaturesVk *featuresVulkan)
224{}
225
226using OverrideFeaturesMtlFunc = void (*)(PlatformMethods *platform,
227 angle::FeaturesMtl *featuresMetal);
228inline void DefaultOverrideFeaturesMtl(PlatformMethods *platform, angle::FeaturesMtl *featuresMetal)
229{}
230
231// Callback on a successful program link with the program binary. Can be used to store
232// shaders to disk. Keys are a 160-bit SHA-1 hash.
233using ProgramKeyType = std::array<uint8_t, 20>;
234using CacheProgramFunc = void (*)(PlatformMethods *platform,
235 const ProgramKeyType &key,
236 size_t programSize,
237 const uint8_t *programBytes);
238inline void DefaultCacheProgram(PlatformMethods *platform,
239 const ProgramKeyType &key,
240 size_t programSize,
241 const uint8_t *programBytes)
242{}
243
244using PostWorkerTaskCallback = void (*)(void *userData);
245using PostWorkerTaskFunc = void (*)(PlatformMethods *platform,
246 PostWorkerTaskCallback callback,
247 void *userData);
248constexpr PostWorkerTaskFunc DefaultPostWorkerTask = nullptr;
249
250// Platform methods are enumerated here once.
251#define ANGLE_PLATFORM_OP(OP) \
252 OP(currentTime, CurrentTime) \
253 OP(monotonicallyIncreasingTime, MonotonicallyIncreasingTime) \
254 OP(logError, LogError) \
255 OP(logWarning, LogWarning) \
256 OP(logInfo, LogInfo) \
257 OP(getTraceCategoryEnabledFlag, GetTraceCategoryEnabledFlag) \
258 OP(addTraceEvent, AddTraceEvent) \
259 OP(updateTraceEventDuration, UpdateTraceEventDuration) \
260 OP(histogramCustomCounts, HistogramCustomCounts) \
261 OP(histogramEnumeration, HistogramEnumeration) \
262 OP(histogramSparse, HistogramSparse) \
263 OP(histogramBoolean, HistogramBoolean) \
264 OP(overrideWorkaroundsD3D, OverrideWorkaroundsD3D) \
265 OP(overrideFeaturesVk, OverrideFeaturesVk) \
266 OP(cacheProgram, CacheProgram) \
267 OP(overrideFeaturesMtl, OverrideFeaturesMtl) \
268 OP(postWorkerTask, PostWorkerTask)
269
270#define ANGLE_PLATFORM_METHOD_DEF(Name, CapsName) CapsName##Func Name = Default##CapsName;
271
272struct ANGLE_PLATFORM_EXPORT PlatformMethods
273{
274 inline PlatformMethods();
275
276 // User data pointer for any implementation specific members. Put it at the start of the
277 // platform structure so it doesn't become overwritten if one version of the platform
278 // adds or removes new members.
279 void *context = 0;
280
281 ANGLE_PLATFORM_OP(ANGLE_PLATFORM_METHOD_DEF)
282};
283
284inline PlatformMethods::PlatformMethods() = default;
285
286#undef ANGLE_PLATFORM_METHOD_DEF
287
288// Subtract one to account for the context pointer.
289constexpr unsigned int g_NumPlatformMethods = (sizeof(PlatformMethods) / sizeof(uintptr_t)) - 1;
290
291#define ANGLE_PLATFORM_METHOD_STRING(Name) #Name
292#define ANGLE_PLATFORM_METHOD_STRING2(Name, CapsName) ANGLE_PLATFORM_METHOD_STRING(Name),
293
294constexpr const char *const g_PlatformMethodNames[g_NumPlatformMethods] = {
295 ANGLE_PLATFORM_OP(ANGLE_PLATFORM_METHOD_STRING2)};
296
297#undef ANGLE_PLATFORM_METHOD_STRING2
298#undef ANGLE_PLATFORM_METHOD_STRING
299
300} // namespace angle
301
302extern "C" {
303
304// Gets the platform methods on the passed-in EGL display. If the method name signature does not
305// match the compiled signature for this ANGLE, false is returned. On success true is returned.
306// The application should set any platform methods it cares about on the returned pointer.
307// If display is not valid, behaviour is undefined.
308
309ANGLE_PLATFORM_EXPORT bool ANGLE_APIENTRY ANGLEGetDisplayPlatform(angle::EGLDisplayType display,
310 const char *const methodNames[],
311 unsigned int methodNameCount,
312 void *context,
313 void *platformMethodsOut);
314
315// Sets the platform methods back to their defaults.
316// If display is not valid, behaviour is undefined.
317ANGLE_PLATFORM_EXPORT void ANGLE_APIENTRY ANGLEResetDisplayPlatform(angle::EGLDisplayType display);
318} // extern "C"
319
320namespace angle
321{
322typedef bool(ANGLE_APIENTRY *GetDisplayPlatformFunc)(angle::EGLDisplayType,
323 const char *const *,
324 unsigned int,
325 void *,
326 void *);
327typedef void(ANGLE_APIENTRY *ResetDisplayPlatformFunc)(angle::EGLDisplayType);
328} // namespace angle
329
330// This function is not exported
331angle::PlatformMethods *ANGLEPlatformCurrent();
332
333#endif // ANGLE_PLATFORMMETHODS_H
